intro: Chiloschista viridiflava, commonly known as the green-flowered chiloschista, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
